page.title: 08A Whittlebury Nine-Year-Old
page.content: On Thursday, 23rd May 1985, I got up at 8 o'clock. It was a bright day. I had a wash, dressed and ate a breakfast of cereal, toast and juice. Dad took me and my brother to school at 8.45. After the register we listened to a schools service broadcast. During lessons I did Maths Adventure and Spell-well. At playtime we played on climbing frames. I did a handwriting card and a science card before lunch. School lunch was cheese pie, chips and tomatoes, followed by a biscuit and a drink. In the afternoon I read to a helper then our teacher read us "The Day Jean-Pierre Went Round The World" by Paul Gallico. I had my violin lesson then went home at 4 o'clock. I played and watched television. We had tea of sausages, potatoes and beans, then apple pie. At 8p.m. I bathed then read in bed.
